definitions.definition: Of or relating to atoms ; composed of atoms; monatomic .
examples: A stream of atomic hydrogen is emitted.

definitions.definition: Employing or relating to nuclear energy or processes .
examples: Some nutjob once built a small atomic pile in his back yard.
The hairs on a dust mite are almost atomic .

definitions.definition: Unable to be split or made any smaller .
examples: A bit is an atomic item of data.

subdefinitions.definition: Containing a single change , as opposed to involving numerous unrelated changes.
labels: of a commit in a VCS
subdefinitions.label_groups: programming , of a commit in a VCS

subdefinitions.definition: Lacking logical operators ; unable to be made simpler in logical form .
Such that for every element b > 0 {\displaystyle b>0} there exists an atom a {\displaystyle a} such that b ≥ a > 0 {\displaystyle b\geq a>0} .
labels: of a partially ordered set with a least element 0
subdefinitions.label_groups: order theory , of a partially ordered set with a least element 0

definitions.definition: Guaranteed to complete either fully or not at all while waiting in a pause, and running synchronously when called by multiple asynchronous threads .
examples: In order to avoid race conditions, this operation has to be atomic .
Whenever possible, use atomic types instead of mutexes.

main_definition: ( physics , chemistry ) Of or relating to atoms ; composed of atoms; monatomic .
secondary_definitions: Employing or relating to nuclear energy or processes .
Unable to be split or made any smaller .
( computing , of an operation ) Guaranteed to complete either fully or not at all while waiting in a pause, and running synchronously when called by multiple asynchronous threads .
